etymologies: mid 19th century: from Latin triangulum ‘triangle’ (see triangle) + -ate

definitions: divide (an area) into triangles for surveying purposes.
shortDefinitions: divide area into triangles for surveying purposes

definitions: measure and map (an area) by the use of triangles with a known base length and base angles.
shortDefinitions: measure and map area by use of triangles with known base length and base angles

definitions: determine (a height, distance, or location) by the use of triangles.
shortDefinitions: determine height, distance, or location by triangulating area

definitions: form into a triangle or triangles
(in politics) position oneself in such a way as to appeal to or appease both left-wing and right-wing standpoints

examples.text: will the president decide to triangulate?

shortDefinitions: position oneself in such way as to appeal to or appease both left-wing and right-wing standpoints
